case_studies.title: Overtime Pay Dispute
case_studies.summary: An employee sued their employer for unpaid overtime, claiming they were misclassified as exempt.
case_studies.outcome: The court ruled in favor of the employee, ordering the employer to pay back wages and damages.
key_points: Employers must keep accurate time records
Non-exempt employees are entitled to overtime pay

case_studies.title: Workplace Discrimination
case_studies.summary: An employee filed a complaint alleging racial discrimination in hiring and promotion practices.
case_studies.outcome: The case was settled out of court, with the employer agreeing to implement new diversity training and revise hiring policies.
key_points: Importance of unbiased hiring and promotion practices
Value of diversity training in the workplace
relevant_laws: Title VII of the Civil Rights Act

case_studies.title: Wrongful Termination
case_studies.summary: An employee claimed they were fired for reporting safety violations to OSHA.
case_studies.outcome: The court found in favor of the employee, citing whistleblower protection laws.
key_points: Whistleblower protections for employees reporting violations
Employer's obligation to maintain a safe workplace
